concept_data.title: full review of the merits of a decision
concept_data.preferred_term: action brought before an administrative court

summary: The concept of "full review of the merits of a decision" pertains to the judicial scrutiny exercised by administrative courts within the EU legal framework. This process, often referred to as an "action brought before an administrative court," allows individuals or entities to challenge administrative decisions, ensuring compliance with legal standards and principles of justice. The review encompasses a comprehensive evaluation of the factual and legal aspects of the decision, enabling courts to assess its validity and lawfulness. This mechanism is crucial for upholding the rule of law and protecting the rights of citizens in the EU regulatory landscape.
